name: State_15

timeline_beats.label: Lagoon settlement and coastal polities form
Integration with River-Kingdom trade networks; merchant houses rise
Corsair confederacies and coastal militia reorganization
Implementation of Migration and Settlement Protocol (T4)

factions.label: Maritime Guilds
factions.influence_hint: dominant in ports; controls ship levies, trade charters, customs

factions.label: Coastal Houses
factions.influence_hint: landed aristocracy; hold fortifications and hinterland rents

factions.label: Tide-Scriptoria
factions.influence_hint: ritual navigators and augurs; gatekeepers of voyage rites

factions.label: Harbor Workers' Leagues
factions.influence_hint: organized dock labor and saltworks; strong urban political voice

traits: heavy nautical lexicon and tide-based timekeeping
ritualized harbor festivals tied to navigation

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics permitted
Long-range mind-influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries must not replace charts or seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialist labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Obligations under A3 (alliance) and T4 (migration/treatment protocols) must be respected
notes: Ports are primary political and economic nodes; inland control weaker
Supply chains for ritual reagents are strategic vulnerabilities
Piracy and smuggling are persistent governance challenges
Lower layers must map reagent import routes, salt flows, and guild-charter controls
Tide-Scriptoria oversee voyage rites; any nav policy must account for their authority
